page.title: 02LANDSCAPE
page.content: Moulton,Gazeley and Kentford are the three villages in this area. Gazeley is the highest point at 79metres, Moulton at 46metres and then Kentford at 30 metres. Kentford is on the border between Suffolk and Cambridge- shire. In about l970 there was a flood on the boundary in Kentford which is on the B 1506. Two roads leading away from the B 1506 go to Gazeley and Moulton. The boundary in Kentford swings off at a right angle across a field. The only markers for the boundary were three dead trees. We planted some new trees on the boundary at the owners suggestion. Kentford and the A45 mark a change in the landscape from the flatness of the fens to the north, and the undulating countryside to the south which is broken only by the valley of the River Kennett.
